comments.commentBody: Only a crook can understand another crook !

He went off script and commended the crowd who cheered his pledge to protect LGBTQ. That sounded like what a leader in a democracy would do, nudging toward rather than forcing a position on a matter that republican voters have diverse opinions about. Give credit where credit is due.

Thiel's sexual orientation is beside the point. He's a libertarian (meaning: Capitalist) with deep pockets and larger ambitions. For Trump and for Thiel both, it's all about money and ego.

http://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2016-07-21/the-strange-politics-o...

@Jacob, Republican's have an intolerance gene,  but the major Republican weakness is always factual. They just don't process facts because they interfere with their dogma whether political or sectarian.

A tedious disgraceful exercise in negativity. Trump said he would protect the "LGBT""Q" community from Islamic terror, but what about the anti- LGBT bigotry of the Republican platform.? He doubled down on his anti- immigration and fear demagoguery. His speech was an overlong marathon, repetitive, full of total fabrications, and a rhetorical disaster. He made the fatal error of responding to his immediate,Right Wing audience and not the millions suffering tediously at home from a speech that was egregiously long.

Honeybee
I have been an RN for decades.
Where have I been?
In the trenches with many ethnic groups, cultural differences, people of all walks of life, all economic groups, political differences, all types of health issues - and more.
Where have you been? Wherever either of us have been, I can guarantee Donald Trump has not been there. As noted every time I fly into LaGuardia and see his planes out on the Tarmac. He single handedly, with no government experience, is going to take care of all the " victims " he uses to manipulate his presidential goal? Good luck with that one. And people eat it right up.
And Mr. Tyuluman cares so much about his hometown's fate and getting Cleveland some help that he moved to Dallas!
At least, he didn't say that Americans are unwilling to do hard work and force USA to accept illegal immigrants.

I never knew our country was so horrible......

But in order to make himself the savior, Trump had to take the country down.
And that he did. Way down.

Yes, very, very dark - except for the balloons and fireworks.

Re: "Does this man [Donald Trump] know how our government works?"

No, he does not. As Tony Schwartz, the true author of "The Art of the Deal" points out, Trump has an extremely small attention span, making it very difficult for Trump to absorb any subject in any kind of depth. Schwartz is convinced that Trump has never once read an entire book ever in his entire adult life.

NO. And as with all low-IQ Republicans, he still hasn't figured out after all these years (since King Ronnie) that TRICKLE-DOWN economcs HASN'T CREATED a whole bunch of new JOBS nor raised the standard of living for any but the wealthy and their lazy, entitled trust-fund offspring.

Are the rest of us just forgettable ?????
Those disagree with you are either ignorant or holding none of your noble values. Funny.
Everything will change on January 20th. Does this man know how our government works?

Perfect! Well said... and terribly frightening all at the same time. I want to believe it never happened... but it did. And we have to be aware that the "Psychopath Next Door" (can't remember who wrote it) is alive and well. We should fear the platitudes and the lies amongst them. We should watch for the artfully crafted Republican statements that sound like they say something important but are instead hollow and meaningless because part one of the sentence has NOTHING to do with part two.
I am truly shaking in my boots because I fear that middle America who doesn't have the same types of multicultural (broader) experiences that we have in NYC (for instance) sees an entirely different Trump than I do.
They don't see the Trump that stole air rights from other buildings in order to build that tall black monstrosity on the upper East Side. That each building in the area sold off a couple of floors, completely unaware that the next building and the next were doing the same thing. Until there was a skyscraper where lower building structures were mandated. And then the whole neighborhood was stuck. That's not being a good businessman. That's just. SLY. SNEAKY.

The book is The Sociopath Next Door, by Martha Stout, Ph.D.
I bought this book years ago so I can more easily recognize the sociopathic men I meet, and to take heed and stay away from them.

This man is only "my voice" if I'm a narcissistic, paranoid schizophrenic.  I've never heard such a dark, fear-mongering Presidential acceptance speech in my life.  All promises, no details.  The Devil is on the loose and I'm the only one who can capture him even though other than hiding behind a wall, I can't tell you how.
Exactly. Unfortunately, it's also exactly what his followers are clamoring for, whether they know it or not.
Hit the the nail on the head.
It's the libertarian's dream, to only pay enough taxes to fund the judicial system, the police, and the military. You get what you pay for.
The country under a President Trump sounds more like a police state.

Yes indeed, ignore them at our risk.

Because they're rabidly angry, armed, and think anyone who doesn't agree with them is complicit with the people they want to wipe off the face of the Earth.
CEOs like Romney and the principals of Bain Capital are the ones who exported jobs.  But lots of those people voted for Romney because of "Right to Life," gay bashing, etc.

"What killed factory jobs in this country was the change in tax law and financial regulations that made 'making things' far less profitable than moving money and introduced venture capitalism."

Uh, Wesley..."free trade" agreements and their restriction on tariffs MADE "moving money" profitable.
We can disagree or mock Trump all we want, but a sizeable chunk of this country agrees with him in content and anger.  Ignore them at our own risk.

Well he invited both Bill and Hillary to his and Melania's wedding so I guess he is exaggerating again.
Maybe one of his kids made him see a real barber - his hair looks better.
I'm not sure about "birth."
Acceptance speeches are generally not filled with "details."
I'm not sure they will want you in it

A speech that has already made history -- for being the longest acceptance.

Trump with his simple messaging (America First), that everyone can relate to (I am with you), will appreciate (Law and Order), understand (LGBTQ rights), and peppered with humility (I'm not sure if I deserved evangelical vote), has set in motion the birth of a new Republican party.
and #notwithmethanks (#imwithher) :)
#notmyvoice
Only voters with a very shaky sense of reality.  And they're already on his side.

No, he is smearing Sec Clinton to the point that voters will conclude he is a misogynist, a racist, and bigoted bullying liar.  That's what all those voters who aren't brown shirt wannabes will conclude.  And there are more decent people in this country than there are brown shirt wannabes - and Sec Clinton is NOT evil.  Donald is.
Should work as well as his University.
Trump's strategy is smearing Mrs. Clinton to the point that voters will conclude that he is the lesser of two evils.

Thanks for the recommendation, Liberal.

I work in a library and I just checked out Paxton's book.

It is a topic very concerning to me, because it is happening right before our eyes.

In fact, I am terrified.

"if hillary promised to wipe out islamic terrorism, i'd give her a chance"

I could promise to wipe out Islamic terrorism too, but I'd be blowing hot air about a problem far too complex for me to handle — just like Trump.
you mean US had bombed somebody on that day?
This is the dark moment the United States began it's march towards fascism.

He was not against the Iraq War until after it was underway and started to have a negative effect on the stock market.

http://www.factcheck.org/2016/02/donald-trump-and-the-iraq-war/

"Most importantly, he could not care less about party ideology."

Or honesty, ethics, morality, human decency and the Constitution. What did I leave out? Enough to fill Trump Tower.

He is the nominee of a party whose Platform states the opposite of all the points you just listed. He will not have the powers of a dictator if he is elected, he will have to work with the members of whichever party controls the House and Senate. And there are lots of people with inherited wealth who quietly do good work and don't brag from the roof tops.   We don't know if he really has all of the wealth he claims, although we might if we could see his tax returns.

I'm so proud of Trump. He beat all odds to become the nominee. He is beholden to no special interests, is no puppet, and has only America's interest at heart.

Most importantly, he could not care less about party ideology. I hate the fact that we are always cabinned into one group of beliefs, or the other. He rejects that.

His independent wealth and mind allow him to adopt the best ideas from both parties. Some examples of his independence: He is pro-LGBT. He was against the Iraq War and said we were stupid for invading. He said W was stupid and failed to keep us safe. He is lockstep with Sanders on trade and demands fair trade. This is the thinking we need!

.
I have definitely read "made A HASH of ..."; possibly colloquial. Your guy could make ASH, although he doesn't make an ASH of himself.

#FeelTheBern

Martin, never heard Make A HASH of. Have heard Make HASH of. Also heard of make a mess of. Maybe Canadians mix up the two to get 33D?

Other than that, I enjoyed the puzzle, especially the quad.
A large portion of the country seems to agree that their country is on the wrong track.
Wow! That was the most relentlessly dark acceptance speech I've ever heard.
Yes, it's a dismal choice indeed.

Oh please. The only people who make the false equivalency between the two candidates are those people who know Clinton only from the media reports of her rather than from actual research. She will look pretty good a week from today.

Such passion and conviction might be admirable, if not for the lies he has told and "policies" he has put forth. I just cannot trust him to be a good president or a good person.

Hillary on the other hand...oh wait.

good observation.   I never thought that his way of making America great again would be to tear everything down, so he could he could make himself savior.   He promises heaven.  Such a salesman, but he reminds me of a snake oil salesman.

"t is not possible to deport US citizens because of their religious beliefs."

I thought the Donald could do anything. Do you think he would let something as trivial as the Constitution get in his way?

i.e. you want free and unchecked immigration from countries that are producing terrorists?

"we must immediately suspend immigration from any nation that has been compromised by terrorism until such time as proven vetting mechanisms have been put in place. We don't want them in our country."

They should be removed from society if they are dangerous to others- regardless of their beliefs.
But unfortunately their danger to society is rooted in their religion, so yes, that islamic religion belief must be dealt along the full spectrum of mass murder prevention methods.
Getting more arabs into US is not going to help our current issues.

This was a terrifying speech.

When he screamed “we don’t want them in our country” I felt sick.
And lies. Crime is down. The deficit is down. Mexican immigrants are not marauders. And Donald Trump does not have a magic wand.
A laundry list of empty promises, with absolutely no details about how he's going to accomplish all of this, cut the deficit and slash taxes to boot. What a fake.
I'm betting that a healthy majority of Americans will choose not to elect this fellow who just ranted at us nonstop for over an hour. It felt like three -- hours and three guys screaming in unison.

There are some kind of things you can't cover up with lipstick and powder (Elvis Costello; Girls Talk)

Wow.....America is on the verge falling into the abyss!!! Mexicans, and Moslems and Blacks...
Oh my!!!!
Psycho Trump presented a pastiche of Nixon 60's, Taft 30's and Mussolini (thrust his chin, pursed lips....occasionally turning sideways.....)
and Nuremberg (USA USA USA.......)
I found it rich that he complains about the "rigged system". As he pointed out: he knows....HE PAID TO CREATE IT!!!!

I found the last song played as ironic and prophetic:
You can't always get what you want.........(M. Jagger)
"Clinton is as bad..."  You just negated everything you wrote right there.  If you cannot see the vast chasm between Trump and Clinton, then you are hopelessly blind.

@Bill
If Clinton wins , you don't need to worry; however, if it's Trump, let the worry begin.

I strongly oppose the TPP. Both Clinton and Kaine support it. I disagree with Clinton on many other issues, not least being regime change in Syria because a violent vacuum is worse for the entire world than a decidedly awful dictator. I also disagree with her positions regarding Wall Street criminality, how to relieve student debt, and numerous other issues. Please don't make me list them all in a comment box on the NY Times website.

Frightening stuff. Too wide-ranging to critique it all, but many things stand out. No mention of cops shooting black people. If I were black and living in the USA, I would be terrified. No exaggeration. On taxes: massive, massive spending promised, but no way to pay for it. Republicans confuse enormous profits by transnational corporations with enormous societal wealth, as does Trump. He promise of jobs sounds to me like a plantation for every slave to work on. No mention of banks and corporations pocketing the wealth of the nation; blames immigrants and other countries -- not the corporations that are actually engaged in plunder -- for Americans' declining economic chances. The law and order stuff is pure 1920's Italian fascism bordering on the 1930's German variety. Trump is promising war with ISIS. Zero comprehension that millions of people want the USA reduced to rubble for what the USA has done to their countries. No one to voter for. Clinton is as bad from her own perspective. I see nothing good coming after January 20, 2017, and I am worried.

Larry- Get a grip. Your rhyming is fun, usually, but Trump has a mental disorder. Cruz, while surely narcissistic, is not even close.

Time to check your own narcissism and speak the truth.
Where did you get that pairing from? It was always obvious that Trump and Cruz utterly despise one another.

The ticket should have been Trump/Cruz,
Two slingers of slimy abuse,
Trump decerebrate,
Cruz, cold icy hate,
Egos in a treacherous truce,

But Trump is chaos at a boil
And Cruz just delights to despoil
No mixing, no matching,
Their enmity patching,
Neither plays according to Hoyle.
l

Fred:

Hillary, warts and all, I'm with you. This is not a mere election. Drumpf is an existential threat to the democratic Republic. Think I overstate? I am merely repeating verbatim the assessment of the Trotskyist rag known as ... The Economist.
Scary.  Fear mongering and nationalism from the start to the finish. Contrived problems with no solutions.  America and Hilary stop Donald Trump this fall.
There is nothing even remotely anti LGBTQ in the GOP platform, and anyways, Trump did not write that platform, and he has no history of being anti-LGBTQ.

@Concerned Citizen

"There is nothing even remotely anti LGBTQ in the GOP platform"

Why would you say something so patently false when anyone can go over to gop.com and download a copy of the platform? I suggest everyone here do so, and take a look for themselves.

Page 31: " Our laws and our government’s regulations
should recognize marriage as the union of one man
and one woman"

Pages 32, 37: Oppose anti-discrimination policies so businesses can refuse service to LGBTQ individuals.

Page 35: Oppose legislation that allow transgender people to use bathrooms of their identified gender

Page 37: Make it legal for parents to force conversion therapy on minors, to "cure" young people of their homosexuality.

Nothing even remotely LGBTQ? I say to you what I would like to say to Trump: STOP LYING.
And he won't protect them from the religious right at home: look whom he chose for his running mate.

"He even vowed “to do everything in my power to protect our L.G.B.T.Q. citizens from the violence and oppression of a hateful foreign ideology.’’

Don't worry, second-class citizens, Trump will protect you even as his party just announced a platform that included aggressively rolling back your rights and portraying you as deviants.
